stream_context.summary: Kaze live-codes and tests the oil-block boss for “Return to Yoshi’s Island,” fighting frame-rate regressions, tweaking movement, camera and hit-detection while also mulling bigger-picture design issues such as completionist expectations and a possible perk system.

development_findings.summary: New code from contributor Silas dropped the game to 30 FPS, so Kaze temporarily rolled back to the previous version.
development_findings.quote: He definitely is 30 FPS again… This is actually Silas’ code… it does not seem to work. Let me check if I still have the old version.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is experimenting with a faster inverse-square-root routine but finds Quake’s famous implementation sub-optimal due to un-tuned constants.
development_findings.quote: They have three constants and they only optimized one of the three constants. How do you do that?

development_findings.summary: The oil-block boss now tracks Mario continuously, dives and rises on a sine curve, and has its speed and camera framing tuned for readability.
Penalty for falling into oil will likely be water-style damage-over-time, not instant death, to avoid frustration.
development_findings.quote: I think water with damage over time is perfect. That is my take on this.

development_findings.summary: A 5 MB WAV track proposed for the dojo area is too large for cartridge space; converting it to MIDI is the tentative solution.
development_findings.quote: That song is huge… It’s gonna take up like 5 megabytes of ROM space… We’d have to turn it into a MIDI and then it would work.

development_findings.summary: Kaze removed 100-coin stars and replaced them with Yoshi Coins that save immediately, eliminating the need to re-enter a level.
development_findings.quote: I removed 100 coin stars because I don’t want the player to find a star and be like, ‘Oh, I should leave and come back later.’

development_findings.summary: He is considering a single-perk system—items hidden in the overworld that let players choose bonuses (e.g., no void-outs or +1 % speed) to smooth difficulty without full RPG-style badges.
development_findings.quote: If anything, it’s gonna be a single perk that you can pick… I don’t want you to build a custom character.

development_findings.summary: Kaze posted a community poll to verify that most players expect to 100 % ROM hacks; early results confirm the expectation, reinforcing his design constraint.
development_findings.quote: The results so far are pretty devastating. So that design space is just closed off to us because of this expectation.

context_findings.summary: Kaze states a design philosophy: players’ feelings are ‘real’ and must be addressed, even if their reasoning is flawed.
context_findings.quote: What people feel, in a way, is real… You can never really ignore people’s feeling.

context_findings.summary: He feels he has been ‘evolving,’ improving at programming, game design and weight-lifting simultaneously.
context_findings.quote: Recently I feel like I have been evolving. I’m just getting so much better at everything for some reason.

context_findings.summary: Personal schedule is compressed because he must attend a wedding; current streams are limited to one day a week until his Banjo project is finished.
context_findings.quote: I’m hoping that eventually I’m done with the Banjo hack and I can go back to streaming twice a week.

context_findings.summary: Kaze expresses strong dislike for weddings and picky eating habits, showing playful on-stream banter with Zeina.

biobak.summary: Suggested using metal teeth objects for the oil-block boss and provided visual feedback on vertex displacement and lighting.
biobak.quote: By metal teeth—I think it looks very cool. That’s a very good idea by Biobak.

biobak.summary: Finished a physical wedding card during the stream and announced it was ready.
biobak.quote: Biobak card is finished. Alright. I just gotta go clean up the car.

badub.summary: Proposed an unused song for the dojo sequence, but the current file is too large; needs conversion to MIDI.
badub.quote: We have a problem though. That song is huge… Right now it’s a WAV file.

zeina.summary: Offered to handle a ‘wedding cart’ animation and sewed a plush toy as a wedding gift, demonstrating her blend of personal and creative support.
zeina.quote: Look—I finally learned how to use a sewing machine too. I almost don’t want to give him away.

zeina.summary: Provided real-time feedback on boss visuals and tried to ‘embarrass’ Kaze on stream, showcasing their playful dynamic.

key_stories.title: Frame-rate Regression
key_stories.summary: Silas supplied a supposedly faster rendering routine, but it unexpectedly halved the frame rate. Kaze diagnosed the issue live and reverted to the previous commit.
key_stories.challenge: Boss level suddenly locked to 30 FPS with new graphics code.
key_stories.process: Verified FPS, compared Git revisions, restored older source, notified Silas.
key_stories.outcome: Performance returned to normal; Silas will need to revise his patch.
key_stories.key_quote: Why is it 30 FPS? God damn it… This is actually Silas’ code.

key_stories.title: Tuning the Oil-Block Boss
key_stories.summary: Kaze iteratively adjusted the boss’s rotation speed, dive depth, camera lock and platform layout so normal players can dodge attacks while still feeling challenged.
key_stories.challenge: Initial behavior was too hard to read and platforms were hard to see.
key_stories.process: Tweaked forward velocity, camera pitch based on distance, block size and dive amplitude; solicited chat and Biobak feedback.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze declared the fight ‘pretty playable’ and moved on to animation polish.
key_stories.key_quote: Honestly I think this is pretty playable. I kind of like it. What do you guys think?

key_stories.title: Completionist Dilemma
key_stories.summary: Kaze realized players expect to fully complete ROM hacks, limiting his ability to hide extremely tough secrets. He polled the community and brainstormed a one-perk system to satisfy both casual and hardcore audiences.
key_stories.challenge: Completionist expectation reduces design freedom for secrets and difficulty spikes.
key_stories.process: Discussed problem on stream, cited Mario 64 Land backlash, created live YouTube poll, brainstormed overworld perks.
key_stories.outcome: Poll confirmed the expectation; Kaze plans to prototype a perk system rather than full badge load-outs.
key_stories.key_quote: That design space is just closed off to us because of this expectation.

open_questions.context: Kaze mentioned he ‘had a cool new idea on how we can maybe increase the FPS’ but the first attempt failed.

questions: What criteria will decide whether the dojo stays?
